item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: blendpixels
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun![/vc_column_text][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="asdasdasd :P"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="42px"][vc_separator color="custom" accent_color="#ebebeb"][bpt_spacing height="42px"][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="Paragraphs"][bpt_spacing height="22px"][vc_column_text]All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. Nevertheless, the technical part of creating a cryptocurrency is not really the most difficult part of launching a successful crypto project. In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="42px"][vc_separator color="custom" accent_color="#ebebeb"][bpt_spacing height="42px"][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="Highlighters"][bpt_spacing height="22px"][vc_column_text]All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. Nevertheless, the technical part of creating a cryptocurrency is not really the most difficult part of launching a successful crypto project. In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="42px"][vc_separator color="custom" accent_color="#ebebeb"][bpt_spacing height="42px"][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="Dropcaps"][bpt_spacing height="22px"][vc_column_text]Yes! You can do it. However, there are many pitfalls that need to be studied before you immerse yourself in the creation of your own cryptocurrency. First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such as bitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Yes! You can do it. However, there are many pitfalls that need to be studied before you immerse yourself in the creation of your own cryptocurrency. First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such as bitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="42px"][vc_separator color="custom" accent_color="#ebebeb"][bpt_spacing height="32px"][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="Blockquote"][bpt_spacing height="22px"][vc_column_text]

I think the internet is going to be one of the major forces for reducing the role of government. The one thing thats missing but that will soon be developed, is a reliable e-cash.

by Adi Shamir
[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="42px"][vc_separator color="custom" accent_color="#ebebeb"][bpt_spacing height="42px"][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="Listing"][bpt_spacing height="22px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][vc_column_text]

Our solution make the market more effective, with higher volume and highest liquidity. The loan originator then checks his/her credit score, evaluates the risk and grants the loan. A borrower makes monthly repayments according to the terms of the credit agreement and the payment schedule. Payment instalments are divided proportionally among investors according to the amount invested in that particular loan.
As soon as the borrower whose loan you have invested in repays the loan, you will start receiving payments of both the principal sum and the interest for that investment period. Funds are automatically transferred to your Fast Invest account. You can reinvest those funds in any other available loan using the Auto Invest tool.[/vc_column_text][/vc_tta_section][vc_tta_section title="Solution" tab_id="1527668118571-9f37d26f-f1fb"][vc_column_text]A person applies for a loan from a loan originator, preparing all the necessary documents and filling in the appropriate forms. item.title: Still Motion
item.dc:creator: developers
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="I. Project Info"][bpt_spacing height="18px"][vc_column_text]First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such as bitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain. Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Coins are often used to transfer financial assets. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc. Tokens are often issued through crowdsales known as the Initial Coin Offering (ICO) They get exchanged for existing coins, which in turn finance projects such as gaming platforms or digital wallets.You can get public tokens after the end of the ICO, as well as buy them using the base currency to make a purchase.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="40px"][bpt_carousel posts_per_line="2" pag_type="line_circle" pag_offset="30" scroll_items="true"][vc_single_image image="1043" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="1041" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="1042" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][bpt_spacing height="30px"][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="II. Process"][bpt_spacing height="20px"][vc_column_text]This option is suitable for most people; platforms will do all the technical work for you. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. You can also create tokens, smart contracts, all with or without a public ICO. Since tokens can represent any asset, you can even create a token that does not have real value or a serious purpose, except for the possibility to be exchanged between friends.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="43px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Idea & Concept" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1047"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Development" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1045"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Testing" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1046"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="III. Usage"][bpt_spacing height="18px"][bpt_custom_text text_color="#57616b" font_size="18" line_height="170"]If you want to make one step further and create a coin with real value for a wider audience, a coin that can be bought, sold, mined, but you do not have programming experience, you probably need the help of one or more developers.[/bpt_custom_text][bpt_spacing height="40px"][vc_single_image image="1048" img_size="full"][bpt_spacing height="45px"][vc_column_text]In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear. Therefore, before deciding on such a responsible step as launching your own cryptocurrency, it is worth to weigh the pros and cons, determine the purpose of its creation, develop an action plan, and conduct market analysis so that eventually your new cryptocurrency.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

Usage"][bpt_spacing height="18px"][bpt_custom_text text_color="#57616b" font_size="18" line_height="170"]If you want to make one step further and create a coin with real value for a wider audience, a coin that can be bought, sold, mined, but you do not have programming experience, you probably need the help of one or more developers.[/bpt_custom_text][bpt_spacing height="40px"][vc_single_image image="1048" img_size="full"][bpt_spacing height="45px"][vc_column_text]In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear. Therefore, before deciding on such a responsible step as launching your own cryptocurrency, it is worth to weigh the pros and cons, determine the purpose of its creation, develop an action plan, and conduct market analysis so that eventually your new cryptocurrency.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

Project Info"][bpt_spacing height="18px"][vc_column_text]First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such as bitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain. Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Coins are often used to transfer financial assets. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc. Tokens are often issued through crowdsales known as the Initial Coin Offering (ICO) They get exchanged for existing coins, which in turn finance projects such as gaming platforms or digital wallets.You can get public tokens after the end of the ICO, as well as buy them using the base currency to make a purchase.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="40px"][bpt_carousel posts_per_line="2" pag_type="line_circle" pag_offset="30" scroll_items="true"][vc_single_image image="1043" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="1041" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="1042" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][bpt_spacing height="30px"][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="II. Process"][bpt_spacing height="20px"][vc_column_text]This option is suitable for most people; platforms will do all the technical work for you. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc. Tokens are often issued through crowdsales known as the Initial Coin Offering (ICO) They get exchanged for existing coins, which in turn finance projects such as gaming platforms or digital wallets.You can get public tokens after the end of the ICO, as well as buy them using the base currency to make a purchase.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="40px"][bpt_carousel posts_per_line="2" pag_type="line_circle" pag_offset="30" scroll_items="true"][vc_single_image image="1043" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="1041" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="1042" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][bpt_spacing height="30px"][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="II. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. You can also create tokens, smart contracts, all with or without a public ICO. Since tokens can represent any asset, you can even create a token that does not have real value or a serious purpose, except for the possibility to be exchanged between friends.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="43px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Idea & Concept" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1047"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Development" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1045"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Testing" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1046"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="III. item.title: SEC Supports Legal Way to Conduct ICOs
item.dc:creator: developers
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1527770518400{margin-top: 34px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text]Yes! You can do it. However, there are many pitfalls that need to be studied before you immerse yourself in the creation of your own cryptocurrency. First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such asbitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Coins are often used to transfer financial assets. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc.

Should I Create My Own Blockchain or Make a Fork of an Existing?

Both methods require quite a lot of technical knowledge or the help of an experienced developer. Since cryptocoins are based on blockchain technology, you will either have to build your own or take an existing one and tailor it to the new coin needs and ideas.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840109611{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]The first method will require serious programming skills. Even though there are already many video courses and other teaching aids for step-by-step execution of this task. 1. You can initiate a fork of an existing blockchain using an open-source code that can be found. 2. You will need to make several changes before launching a new blockchain with a new name. 3. You to clearly identify the goals of the project and understand the code so that you know what you need to change and why. 4. Even if you do everything right, you may face a lot of unexpected problems.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840230026{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]

Creating a Coin or a Token Using Specialized Platforms

This option is suitable for most people; platforms will do all the technical work for you. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. [bpt_carousel use_pagination="" use_prev_next="true" custom_buttons_color="true"][vc_single_image image="23" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="24" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="25" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527838396320{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]

Dealing with Other Important Issues

Nevertheless, the technical part of creating a cryptocurrency is not really the most difficult part of launching a successful crypto project. The biggest difficulty is in presenting and marketing your new coin. You need to convince people of its symbolic value, support the community.

The crypto currency community hasnt decided whether they want to be anarchist rebels or to replace the establishment

by Adi Shamir
In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: If you are not a programmer but carefully follow all news about Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, then sooner or later you might come up with the question; can I create my own cryptocurrency?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: This is a physical manifestation of a digital concept. Stuff this under the mattress or in your safe and you will not lose it. Need to give them to someone who has no computer smarts? No problem.
I think it's absolutely brilliant. An end to fiat at last and something that anyone can understand. I think this will boost bitcoin's acceptability and price no end.

Even if you do everything right, you may face a lot of unexpected problems.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840230026{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]

Creating a Coin or a Token Using Specialized Platforms

This option is suitable for most people; platforms will do all the technical work for you. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. [bpt_carousel use_pagination="" use_prev_next="true" custom_buttons_color="true"][vc_single_image image="23" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="24" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="25" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527838396320{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]

Dealing with Other Important Issues

Nevertheless, the technical part of creating a cryptocurrency is not really the most difficult part of launching a successful crypto project. The biggest difficulty is in presenting and marketing your new coin. You need to convince people of its symbolic value, support the community.

The crypto currency community hasnt decided whether they want to be anarchist rebels or to replace the establishment

by Adi Shamir
In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: If you are not a programmer but carefully follow all news about Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, then sooner or later you might come up with the question; can I create my own cryptocurrency?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I think it's absolutely brilliant. An end to fiat at last and something that anyone can understand. I think this will boost bitcoin's acceptability and price no end.
This is a physical manifestation of a digital concept. Stuff this under the mattress or in your safe and you will not lose it. Need to give them to someone who has no computer smarts? No problem.

item.title: SEC Supports Legal Way to Conduct ICOs
item.dc:creator: developers
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1527770518400{margin-top: 34px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text]Yes! You can do it. However, there are many pitfalls that need to be studied before you immerse yourself in the creation of your own cryptocurrency. First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such asbitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Coins are often used to transfer financial assets. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc.

Should I Create My Own Blockchain or Make a Fork of an Existing?

Both methods require quite a lot of technical knowledge or the help of an experienced developer. Since cryptocoins are based on blockchain technology, you will either have to build your own or take an existing one and tailor it to the new coin needs and ideas.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840109611{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]The first method will require serious programming skills. Even though there are already many video courses and other teaching aids for step-by-step execution of this task. 1. You can initiate a fork of an existing blockchain using an open-source code that can be found. 2. You will need to make several changes before launching a new blockchain with a new name. 3. You to clearly identify the goals of the project and understand the code so that you know what you need to change and why. 4. Even if you do everything right, you may face a lot of unexpected problems.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840230026{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]

The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. item.title: Still Motion
item.dc:creator: developers
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="I. Project Info"][bpt_spacing height="18px"][vc_column_text]First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such as bitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain. Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Coins are often used to transfer financial assets. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc. Tokens are often issued through crowdsales known as the Initial Coin Offering (ICO) They get exchanged for existing coins, which in turn finance projects such as gaming platforms or digital wallets.You can get public tokens after the end of the ICO, as well as buy them using the base currency to make a purchase.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="40px"][bpt_carousel posts_per_line="2" pag_type="line_circle" pag_offset="30" scroll_items="true"][vc_single_image image="1043" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="1041" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="1042" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][bpt_spacing height="30px"][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="II. Process"][bpt_spacing height="20px"][vc_column_text]This option is suitable for most people; platforms will do all the technical work for you. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. You can also create tokens, smart contracts, all with or without a public ICO. Since tokens can represent any asset, you can even create a token that does not have real value or a serious purpose, except for the possibility to be exchanged between friends.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="43px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Idea & Concept" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1047"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Development" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1045"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Testing" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1046"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="III. Usage"][bpt_spacing height="18px"][bpt_custom_text text_color="#57616b" font_size="18" line_height="170"]If you want to make one step further and create a coin with real value for a wider audience, a coin that can be bought, sold, mined, but you do not have programming experience, you probably need the help of one or more developers.[/bpt_custom_text][bpt_spacing height="40px"][vc_single_image image="1048" img_size="full"][bpt_spacing height="45px"][vc_column_text]In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear. Therefore, before deciding on such a responsible step as launching your own cryptocurrency, it is worth to weigh the pros and cons, determine the purpose of its creation, develop an action plan, and conduct market analysis so that eventually your new cryptocurrency.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such as bitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain. Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Coins are often used to transfer financial assets. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc. Tokens are often issued through crowdsales known as the Initial Coin Offering (ICO) They get exchanged for existing coins, which in turn finance projects such as gaming platforms or digital wallets.You can get public tokens after the end of the ICO, as well as buy them using the base currency to make a purchase.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="40px"][bpt_carousel posts_per_line="2" pag_type="line_circle" pag_offset="30" scroll_items="true"][vc_single_image image="1043" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="1041" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="1042" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][bpt_spacing height="30px"][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="II. Process"][bpt_spacing height="20px"][vc_column_text]This option is suitable for most people; platforms will do all the technical work for you. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. You can also create tokens, smart contracts, all with or without a public ICO. Since tokens can represent any asset, you can even create a token that does not have real value or a serious purpose, except for the possibility to be exchanged between friends.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="43px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Idea & Concept" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1047"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Development" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1045"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Testing" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1046"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="III. Usage"][bpt_spacing height="18px"][bpt_custom_text text_color="#57616b" font_size="18" line_height="170"]If you want to make one step further and create a coin with real value for a wider audience, a coin that can be bought, sold, mined, but you do not have programming experience, you probably need the help of one or more developers.[/bpt_custom_text][bpt_spacing height="40px"][vc_single_image image="1048" img_size="full"][bpt_spacing height="45px"][vc_column_text]In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear. Therefore, before deciding on such a responsible step as launching your own cryptocurrency, it is worth to weigh the pros and cons, determine the purpose of its creation, develop an action plan, and conduct market analysis so that eventually your new cryptocurrency.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

Usage"][bpt_spacing height="18px"][bpt_custom_text text_color="#57616b" font_size="18" line_height="170"]If you want to make one step further and create a coin with real value for a wider audience, a coin that can be bought, sold, mined, but you do not have programming experience, you probably need the help of one or more developers.[/bpt_custom_text][bpt_spacing height="40px"][vc_single_image image="1048" img_size="full"][bpt_spacing height="45px"][vc_column_text]In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear. Therefore, before deciding on such a responsible step as launching your own cryptocurrency, it is worth to weigh the pros and cons, determine the purpose of its creation, develop an action plan, and conduct market analysis so that eventually your new cryptocurrency.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.dc:creator: developers
item.content:encoded: [vc_row][vc_column][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="I. Project Info"][bpt_spacing height="18px"][vc_column_text]First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such as bitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain. Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Coins are often used to transfer financial assets. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc. Tokens are often issued through crowdsales known as the Initial Coin Offering (ICO) They get exchanged for existing coins, which in turn finance projects such as gaming platforms or digital wallets.You can get public tokens after the end of the ICO, as well as buy them using the base currency to make a purchase.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="40px"][bpt_carousel posts_per_line="2" pag_type="line_circle" pag_offset="30" scroll_items="true"][vc_single_image image="1043" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="1041" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="1042" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][bpt_spacing height="30px"][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="II. Process"][bpt_spacing height="20px"][vc_column_text]This option is suitable for most people; platforms will do all the technical work for you. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. You can also create tokens, smart contracts, all with or without a public ICO. Since tokens can represent any asset, you can even create a token that does not have real value or a serious purpose, except for the possibility to be exchanged between friends.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="43px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Idea & Concept" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1047"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Development" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1045"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/3"][bpt_flip_box fb_height="185" add_shadow="" front_bg_style="front_image" front_title="Testing" front_descr="The present crypto currency market is very competitive and it going to be more within next few month." back_descr="The platform combines the functionality of a distributed information system (GIS), computer vision technology, 3D simulation and artificial intelligence (AI)...." front_bg_image="1046"][bpt_spacing height="40px"][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][bpt_double_headings title_color="#1b3452" title_size="30px" subtitle_color="#14c7ff" title="III. item.title: Tech Analysis ICO / U.S. Dollar
item.dc:creator: developers
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1527770518400{margin-top: 34px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text]Yes! You can do it. However, there are many pitfalls that need to be studied before you immerse yourself in the creation of your own cryptocurrency. First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such asbitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Coins are often used to transfer financial assets. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc.

Should I Create My Own Blockchain or Make a Fork of an Existing?

Both methods require quite a lot of technical knowledge or the help of an experienced developer. Since cryptocoins are based on blockchain technology, you will either have to build your own or take an existing one and tailor it to the new coin needs and ideas.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840109611{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]The first method will require serious programming skills. Even though there are already many video courses and other teaching aids for step-by-step execution of this task. 1. You can initiate a fork of an existing blockchain using an open-source code that can be found. 2. You will need to make several changes before launching a new blockchain with a new name. 3. You to clearly identify the goals of the project and understand the code so that you know what you need to change and why. 4. Even if you do everything right, you may face a lot of unexpected problems.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840230026{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]

Creating a Coin or a Token Using Specialized Platforms

This option is suitable for most people; platforms will do all the technical work for you. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. [bpt_carousel use_pagination="" use_prev_next="true" custom_buttons_color="true"][vc_single_image image="23" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="24" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="25" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527838396320{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]

Dealing with Other Important Issues

Nevertheless, the technical part of creating a cryptocurrency is not really the most difficult part of launching a successful crypto project. The biggest difficulty is in presenting and marketing your new coin. You need to convince people of its symbolic value, support the community.

The crypto currency community hasnt decided whether they want to be anarchist rebels or to replace the establishment

by Adi Shamir
In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: If you are not a programmer but carefully follow all news about Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, then sooner or later you might come up with the question; can I create my own cryptocurrency?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I think it's absolutely brilliant. An end to fiat at last and something that anyone can understand. I think this will boost bitcoin's acceptability and price no end.
This is a physical manifestation of a digital concept. Stuff this under the mattress or in your safe and you will not lose it. Need to give them to someone who has no computer smarts? No problem.

Nevertheless, the technical part of creating a cryptocurrency is not really the most difficult part of launching a successful crypto project. The biggest difficulty is in presenting and marketing your new coin. You need to convince people of its symbolic value, support the community.

The crypto currency community hasnt decided whether they want to be anarchist rebels or to replace the establishment

by Adi Shamir
In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: If you are not a programmer but carefully follow all news about Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, then sooner or later you might come up with the question; can I create my own cryptocurrency?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I think it's absolutely brilliant. An end to fiat at last and something that anyone can understand. I think this will boost bitcoin's acceptability and price no end.
This is a physical manifestation of a digital concept. Stuff this under the mattress or in your safe and you will not lose it. Need to give them to someone who has no computer smarts? No problem.

item.title: Telegram ICO May Not Happen
item.dc:creator: developers
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1527770518400{margin-top: 34px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text]Yes! You can do it. However, there are many pitfalls that need to be studied before you immerse yourself in the creation of your own cryptocurrency. First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such asbitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Coins are often used to transfer financial assets. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc.

Should I Create My Own Blockchain or Make a Fork of an Existing?

Both methods require quite a lot of technical knowledge or the help of an experienced developer. Since cryptocoins are based on blockchain technology, you will either have to build your own or take an existing one and tailor it to the new coin needs and ideas.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840109611{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]The first method will require serious programming skills. Even though there are already many video courses and other teaching aids for step-by-step execution of this task. 1. You can initiate a fork of an existing blockchain using an open-source code that can be found. 2. You will need to make several changes before launching a new blockchain with a new name. 3. You to clearly identify the goals of the project and understand the code so that you know what you need to change and why. 4. Even if you do everything right, you may face a lot of unexpected problems.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840230026{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]

Creating a Coin or a Token Using Specialized Platforms

This option is suitable for most people; platforms will do all the technical work for you. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. [bpt_carousel use_pagination="" use_prev_next="true" custom_buttons_color="true"][vc_single_image image="23" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="24" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="25" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527838396320{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]

Dealing with Other Important Issues

Nevertheless, the technical part of creating a cryptocurrency is not really the most difficult part of launching a successful crypto project. The biggest difficulty is in presenting and marketing your new coin. You need to convince people of its symbolic value, support the community.

The crypto currency community hasnt decided whether they want to be anarchist rebels or to replace the establishment

by Adi Shamir
In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]

The crypto currency community hasnt decided whether they want to be anarchist rebels or to replace the establishment

by Adi Shamir
In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: If you are not a programmer but carefully follow all news about Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, then sooner or later you might come up with the question; can I create my own cryptocurrency?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I think it's absolutely brilliant. An end to fiat at last and something that anyone can understand. I think this will boost bitcoin's acceptability and price no end.
This is a physical manifestation of a digital concept. Stuff this under the mattress or in your safe and you will not lose it. Need to give them to someone who has no computer smarts? No problem.

item.title: How to Create Your Own Cryptocurrency
item.dc:creator: developers
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1527770518400{margin-top: 34px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text]Yes! You can do it. However, there are many pitfalls that need to be studied before you immerse yourself in the creation of your own cryptocurrency. First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such asbitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Coins are often used to transfer financial assets. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc.

Should I Create My Own Blockchain or Make a Fork of an Existing?

Both methods require quite a lot of technical knowledge or the help of an experienced developer. Since cryptocoins are based on blockchain technology, you will either have to build your own or take an existing one and tailor it to the new coin needs and ideas.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840109611{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]The first method will require serious programming skills. Even though there are already many video courses and other teaching aids for step-by-step execution of this task. 1. You can initiate a fork of an existing blockchain using an open-source code that can be found. 2. You will need to make several changes before launching a new blockchain with a new name. 3. You to clearly identify the goals of the project and understand the code so that you know what you need to change and why. 4. Even if you do everything right, you may face a lot of unexpected problems.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840230026{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]

Creating a Coin or a Token Using Specialized Platforms

This option is suitable for most people; platforms will do all the technical work for you. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. [bpt_carousel use_pagination="" use_prev_next="true" custom_buttons_color="true"][vc_single_image image="23" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="24" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="25" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527838396320{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]

Dealing with Other Important Issues

Nevertheless, the technical part of creating a cryptocurrency is not really the most difficult part of launching a successful crypto project. The biggest difficulty is in presenting and marketing your new coin. You need to convince people of its symbolic value, support the community.

The crypto currency community hasnt decided whether they want to be anarchist rebels or to replace the establishment

by Adi Shamir
In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Every Crypto Trading Tool Under One Roof: FTEC
item.dc:creator: developers
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1527770518400{margin-top: 34px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text]Yes! You can do it. However, there are many pitfalls that need to be studied before you immerse yourself in the creation of your own cryptocurrency. First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such asbitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Coins are often used to transfer financial assets. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc.

Should I Create My Own Blockchain or Make a Fork of an Existing?

Both methods require quite a lot of technical knowledge or the help of an experienced developer. Since cryptocoins are based on blockchain technology, you will either have to build your own or take an existing one and tailor it to the new coin needs and ideas.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840109611{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]The first method will require serious programming skills. Even though there are already many video courses and other teaching aids for step-by-step execution of this task. 1. You can initiate a fork of an existing blockchain using an open-source code that can be found. 2. You will need to make several changes before launching a new blockchain with a new name. 3. You to clearly identify the goals of the project and understand the code so that you know what you need to change and why. 4. Even if you do everything right, you may face a lot of unexpected problems.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840230026{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]

Creating a Coin or a Token Using Specialized Platforms

This option is suitable for most people; platforms will do all the technical work for you. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. [bpt_carousel use_pagination="" use_prev_next="true" custom_buttons_color="true"][vc_single_image image="23" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="24" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="25" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527838396320{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]

Dealing with Other Important Issues

Nevertheless, the technical part of creating a cryptocurrency is not really the most difficult part of launching a successful crypto project. The biggest difficulty is in presenting and marketing your new coin. You need to convince people of its symbolic value, support the community.

The crypto currency community hasnt decided whether they want to be anarchist rebels or to replace the establishment

by Adi Shamir
In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]

No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: If you are not a programmer but carefully follow all news about Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, then sooner or later you might come up with the question; can I create my own cryptocurrency?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I think it's absolutely brilliant. An end to fiat at last and something that anyone can understand. I think this will boost bitcoin's acceptability and price no end.
This is a physical manifestation of a digital concept. Stuff this under the mattress or in your safe and you will not lose it. Need to give them to someone who has no computer smarts? No problem.

item.title: How to Create a Bitcoin Paper Wallet or Paper Bill
item.dc:creator: developers
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1527770518400{margin-top: 34px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text]Yes! You can do it. However, there are many pitfalls that need to be studied before you immerse yourself in the creation of your own cryptocurrency. First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such asbitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Coins are often used to transfer financial assets. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc.

Should I Create My Own Blockchain or Make a Fork of an Existing?

Both methods require quite a lot of technical knowledge or the help of an experienced developer. Since cryptocoins are based on blockchain technology, you will either have to build your own or take an existing one and tailor it to the new coin needs and ideas.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840109611{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]The first method will require serious programming skills. Even though there are already many video courses and other teaching aids for step-by-step execution of this task. 1. You can initiate a fork of an existing blockchain using an open-source code that can be found. 2. You will need to make several changes before launching a new blockchain with a new name. 3. You to clearly identify the goals of the project and understand the code so that you know what you need to change and why. 4. Even if you do everything right, you may face a lot of unexpected problems.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840230026{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]

Creating a Coin or a Token Using Specialized Platforms

This option is suitable for most people; platforms will do all the technical work for you. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. [bpt_carousel use_pagination="" use_prev_next="true" custom_buttons_color="true"][vc_single_image image="23" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="24" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="25" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527838396320{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]

Dealing with Other Important Issues

Nevertheless, the technical part of creating a cryptocurrency is not really the most difficult part of launching a successful crypto project. The biggest difficulty is in presenting and marketing your new coin. You need to convince people of its symbolic value, support the community.

The crypto currency community hasnt decided whether they want to be anarchist rebels or to replace the establishment

by Adi Shamir
In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.excerpt:encoded: If you are not a programmer but carefully follow all news about Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, then sooner or later you might come up with the question; can I create my own cryptocurrency?

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Bitcoin is exciting because it shows how cheap it can be. Bitcoin is better than currency in that you dont have to be physically in the same place and, of course, for large transactions, currency can get pretty inconvenient.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I think it's absolutely brilliant. An end to fiat at last and something that anyone can understand. I think this will boost bitcoin's acceptability and price no end.

item.title: Tech Analysis ICO / U.S. Dollar
item.dc:creator: developers
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row css=".vc_custom_1527770518400{margin-top: 34px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text]Yes! You can do it. However, there are many pitfalls that need to be studied before you immerse yourself in the creation of your own cryptocurrency. First of all, it is important to understand the difference between coins and tokens. Both can be called cryptocurrency, but if coins (such asbitcoin or litecoin) work using their own blockchains, tokens live on top of existing infrastructure, such as the Ethereum blockchain Blockchain, in fact, is a record of transactions protected by the network. So, coins have their own independent transaction registers, and tokens rely on some third-party network to confirm and secure transactions. Coins are often used to transfer financial assets. Tokens have much more functions this is a kind of digital contract for almost anything; physical objects, events tickets, loyalty points, etc.

Should I Create My Own Blockchain or Make a Fork of an Existing?

Both methods require quite a lot of technical knowledge or the help of an experienced developer. Since cryptocoins are based on blockchain technology, you will either have to build your own or take an existing one and tailor it to the new coin needs and ideas.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840109611{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]The first method will require serious programming skills. Even though there are already many video courses and other teaching aids for step-by-step execution of this task. 1. You can initiate a fork of an existing blockchain using an open-source code that can be found. 2. You will need to make several changes before launching a new blockchain with a new name. 3. You to clearly identify the goals of the project and understand the code so that you know what you need to change and why. 4. Even if you do everything right, you may face a lot of unexpected problems.[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527840230026{margin-top: 11px !important;}"]

Creating a Coin or a Token Using Specialized Platforms

This option is suitable for most people; platforms will do all the technical work for you. For example, CryptoLife helps to create the simplest coin. All you need to do is enter the necessary parameters like the logo, number of coins received by miners for signing a block, etc. They even have pre-built templates where you only need to specify a name and a symbol. The base price of this service is 0.25 BTC. WalletBuilders is a similar service; prices start at 0.01 BTC, and there is a free test version. [bpt_carousel use_pagination="" use_prev_next="true" custom_buttons_color="true"][vc_single_image image="23" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="24" img_size="full"][vc_single_image image="25" img_size="full"][/bpt_carousel][/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1527838396320{margin-top: 32px !important;}"]

Dealing with Other Important Issues

Nevertheless, the technical part of creating a cryptocurrency is not really the most difficult part of launching a successful crypto project. The biggest difficulty is in presenting and marketing your new coin. You need to convince people of its symbolic value, support the community.

The crypto currency community hasnt decided whether they want to be anarchist rebels or to replace the establishment

by Adi Shamir
In addition, stats numbers are cruel; many cryptocurrencies are unsuccessful, some are doubtful from a legal point of view. There are different reasons for this, maybe they failed to run a quality ICO, or the coin failed to provide long-term interest. No wonder that the term shitcoin appeared, and it seems that it does not intend to disappear.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row]

Personal Experience

[/bpt_custom_text][bpt_spacing height="20px"][vc_column_text]Martin Parker is the CEO of the Cryptronick and the mastermind behind the Cryptronick brand. His vision lead to the award winning platform with millions of clients and his vision is leading the creation of the Cryptronick ecosystem. An MBA with an MSENG and love for disruptive technologies. Early career in development of software solutions, including electronic payment systems. Internationally-minded, moved from corporate to small ventures in Scandinavia, complemented with an MBA in China and a brief advisory role. Now engaged in business development and strategic development of cool new ventures.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="20px"][vc_column_text]He has more than 5 years experience of building and leading effective development teams (up to 50 developers). item.title: David Spenser
item.dc:creator: developers
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][bpt_custom_text text_color="#1b3452" font_size="24"]

Personal Experience

[/bpt_custom_text][bpt_spacing height="20px"][vc_column_text]Martin Parker is the CEO of the Cryptronick and the mastermind behind the Cryptronick brand. His vision lead to the award winning platform with millions of clients and his vision is leading the creation of the Cryptronick ecosystem. An MBA with an MSENG and love for disruptive technologies. Early career in development of software solutions, including electronic payment systems. Internationally-minded, moved from corporate to small ventures in Scandinavia, complemented with an MBA in China and a brief advisory role. Now engaged in business development and strategic development of cool new ventures.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="20px"][vc_column_text]He has more than 5 years experience of building and leading effective development teams (up to 50 developers). He developed successful proven high load projects with multi-million daily active audience. He is also a crypto expert with more than 3 years of experience in blockchain.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="37px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][bpt_custom_text text_color="#1b3452" font_size="24"]

Skills

[/bpt_custom_text][bpt_spacing height="17px"][vc_progress_bar values="%5B%7B%22label%22%3A%22Security%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2260%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%2390ff98%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22Regulation%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2255%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%2346e1ac%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22Integration%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2280%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%2314c7ff%22%7D%2C%7B%22label%22%3A%22Technology%22%2C%22value%22%3A%2235%22%2C%22color%22%3A%22custom%22%2C%22customcolor%22%3A%22%230d7ffa%22%7D%5D" bgcolor="custom" units="%"][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][bpt_custom_text text_color="#1b3452" font_size="24"]

Chronology

[/bpt_custom_text][bpt_spacing height="22px"][vc_column_text]2015-Present CEO, Senior Software Engineer of Cryptronick[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="24px"][vc_column_text]2008-2015 Senior Software Development, Project Manager, Cisco Network[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="24px"][vc_column_text]2000-2008 Team Leader, Software Design and Development, Lenovo[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][bpt_spacing height="42px"][bpt_custom_text text_color="#1b3452" font_size="24"]

Technical Experience

[/bpt_custom_text][bpt_spacing height="22px"][vc_column_text]With more than 12 years of experience in digital marketing has become an expert at driving growth in any business, especially in blockchain related ventures. is the founder of several companies including New Challenge. Martin Parker is the CEO of the Cryptronick and the mastermind behind the Cryptronick brand. His vision lead to the award winning platform with millions of clients and his vision is leading the creation of the Cryptronick ecosystem. An MBA with an MSENG and love for disruptive technologies. Early career in development of software solutions, including electronic payment systems. Internationally-minded, moved from corporate to small ventures in Scandinavia, complemented with an MBA in China and a brief advisory role.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="33px"][bpt_custom_text text_color="#1b3452" font_size="24"]

Contact Me

[/bpt_custom_text][bpt_spacing height="18px"][contact-form-7 id="682"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][bpt_custom_text text_color="#1b3452" font_size="24"]

Personal Experience

[/bpt_custom_text][bpt_spacing height="20px"][vc_column_text]Martin Parker is the CEO of the Cryptronick and the mastermind behind the Cryptronick brand. His vision lead to the award winning platform with millions of clients and his vision is leading the creation of the Cryptronick ecosystem. An MBA with an MSENG and love for disruptive technologies. Early career in development of software solutions, including electronic payment systems. Internationally-minded, moved from corporate to small ventures in Scandinavia, complemented with an MBA in China and a brief advisory role. Now engaged in business development and strategic development of cool new ventures.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="20px"][vc_column_text]He has more than 5 years experience of building and leading effective development teams (up to 50 developers). He developed successful proven high load projects with multi-million daily active audience. He is also a crypto expert with more than 3 years of experience in blockchain.[/vc_column_text][bpt_spacing height="37px"][vc_row_inner][vc_column_inner width="1/2"][bpt_custom_text text_color="#1b3452" font_size="24"]
